00051 #endif
00052 
00053 /**
00054  * \ingroup Shape
00055  * \brief Shape Struct
00056  *
00057  * \description
00058  *
00059  *  This struct holds information about shapes. Currently
00060  *  the info is about the sides of the shape only, which is
00061  *  skin information. If you want to keep the elements of the
00062  *  shape itself, then segment the
00063  *  mesh first to get that information and then call
00064  *  \ref fc_getSubsetShapes on each segment separately.
00065  *
00066  *  Note that the order of the struct arrays and matrix matters, that is
00067  *  The 0th element of the face array is the same side as the
00068  *  0th element of the elem array and is the same side as that
00069  *  referred to by the 0th row and col of the adjcency matrix.
00070  *
00071  *
00072  * \todo
00073  *  - may want to have a struct that does that the shape innards as well
00074  *    (e.g., I use the innards in projecting the dead element region
00075  *     onto a side)
00076  *  - may want a method to do the segment first as well so the
00077  *    user doesnt have to call that separately, or add a method
00078  *    that can generate the shape elements for you afterwards
00079  *    once you have the shape.
00080  *  - may want to add edge info into the struct
00081  *
00082  * \modifications
00083  *  - 6/XX/06 ACG created.
00084  *  - 7/16/06 ACG dropped "skin" in name
00085  */
00086 typedef struct {
00087   int numSides;         /**< number of sides of the shape */
00088   FC_Subset *faces;     /**< array of faces making up the sides */
00089   FC_Subset *elems;     /**< array of elems making up the sides */
00090   int **adjmatrix;      /**< adjacency matrix or the sides */
00091 } FC_Shape;
00092 
00093 
00094 //***********elementary methods***********************/
00095 //get sides
00096 
00097 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSubsetShapes(FC_Subset subset, double angle,
00098                      int shared_dim, int *numShapes,
00099                      FC_Shape **shapes);

00101                      int shared_dim, int *numShapes,
00102                      FC_Shape **shapes);

00104                       FC_Shape *newshape);
00105 FC_ReturnCode fc_reduceShapeNumSides(FC_Shape *inshape, int endsides,
00106                         FC_Shape *reducedshape);
00107

00110                             FC_Subset *facesubsets,
00111                             int shared_dim,
00112                             int ***intmatrix);
00113

00115                          int *numsegments, int**sidespersegment,
00116                          int ***sideids);

00119                         int ***distmatrix);
